Re ''Updating a Paperback Heroine: Can Mary Higgins Clark Lure Her Faithful to E-Books?'' (Business Day, May 22):

The other night, while doing paperwork, checking my children's homework and taking care of a myriad of routine tasks, I happened to glance at a bookcase in the room. My eye fell on a slim volume that I have not touched in a good 15 years.

On impulse, I pulled out ''The Prophet,'' by Kahlil Gibran, and started to read. The poetry brought me joy; the author's illustrations added to the beauty of the book. My evening was transformed from hectic to peaceful within a few short pages.
Would this have happened with an e-book version of ''The Prophet,'' tucked away in my computer? Doubtful.
MARIA D. LA MALFA St. James, N.Y., May 24, 2000
